items.title: Upload with Inertia.js
items.description: A complete file upload form example integrated with Laravel Inertia.js, showing form handling, validation, and submission.
items.docs:
Complete file upload module for Inertia.js with Laravel integration.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Installation:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------

1. Install the React components and command via shadcn:
   npx shadcn@latest add [REGISTRY_URL]/r/upload-inertia.json

2. Run the setup command to install dependencies and controllers:
   php artisan react-s3-upload:install

The install command will:
• Install required Composer dependencies (league/flysystem-aws-s3-v3)
• Copy Laravel controllers from node_modules to your app
• Add routes to routes/web.php
• Provide setup instructions

Note: The install command is automatically available after step 1 (Laravel auto-discovers commands in app/Console/Commands)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Usage:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------

import { UploadInertia } from '@/components/upload/upload-inertia';

<UploadInertia 
  signedUrlEndpoint="/upload/signed-url"
  maxFiles={5}
  maxSize={10 * 1024 * 1024} // 10MB
/>

--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Manual Routes (if needed):
--------------------------------------------------------------------------

Route::post('/documents', App\Http\Controllers\DocumentCreateController::class)
    ->middleware(['auth'])
    ->name('documents.create');

Route::post('/upload/signed-url', App\Http\Controllers\SignedUrlController::class)
    ->middleware(['auth'])
    ->name('upload.signed-url');
